message.content:
<<<api>>>: ServerListPingEvent, setMaxPlayers(int mxPlayers)
<<<code>>>: To set a virtual number for the online player count, you can create a variable in your plugin to store the virtual player count. Then, in your ServerListPingEvent, you can set the player count to the virtual count using the setOnlinePlayers(int onlinePlayers) method. Here's an example:

int virtualPlayerCount = 100; // Set your desired virtual player count

@EventHandler
public void onServerListPing(ServerListPingEvent event) {
    event.setMaxPlayers(1000); // Set your desired virtual max player count
    event.setOnlinePlayers(virtualPlayerCount); // Set the virtual player count
}

To get the players via a query in your plugin, you can use the Bukkit.getServer().getOnlinePlayers() method to get a list of online players. Here's an example:

List<Player> onlinePlayers = new ArrayList<>(Bukkit.getServer().getOnlinePlayers());
int actualPlayerCount = onlinePlayers.size(); // Get the actual player count

Note that the actual player count will be the real number of players currently online, while the virtual player count will be the number you set in the ServerListPingEvent.
